info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 12:45PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Berks County through 115 PM EDT... At 1245 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Kleinfeltersville, or near Myerstown, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Reading, Wyomissing, Birdsboro, Sinking Spring, Laureldale, Womelsdorf, Wernersville, Robesonia, Leesport, Elverson, Bernville, Strausstown, New Morgan, Spring Ridge, Fairview Hgts, Shillington, West Reading, Mount Penn, Mohnton and Kenhorst. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 296 and 300. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 21 and 27. Interstate 176 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 1 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
